item.title: Challenge Neovision x Ens'IA 2022
item.author: Author
item.description: What is this challenge about? This is an artificial intelligence challenge organized jointly by Neovision and Ens’IA. For the second edition of this challenge, participants had to create an AI, but don’t panic: Neovision coaches will were there to accompany them. There were also workshops to give them additional knowledge! This challenge were for participants the opportunity to live a real AI project and to deepen their knowledge, but also and above all to have fun and to meet people

item.title: Ensimag's software engineering project
item.author: Author
item.description: What is the project about ? The goal is to build in Java a compiler with no default for a language called Deca (Java like language) The compilation process is divided into 3 steps : The syntax analysis (Lexer and Parser) input : source program output : primitive abstract tree The contextual verification input : primitive abstract tree output : abstract tree decorated The code generation for an abstract machine input : abstract tree decorated output : assembly program Finally, the project is also composed of a theme of our choice.

item.title: Database project
item.author: Author
item.description: The project The e-commerce company for individuals, Gange, wants us to set up a database to better manage the products they offer for sale. The sales are based auction mode: Users make increasing bids on available products and the 5th bid wins. The auction mode is not important, it can should changed easily, and is not known by Gange’s customers. The products are categorized and and a recommendation mode should be implemented.

item.title: Ens'IA association
item.author: Author
item.description: What is Ens’IA Ens’IA is a french AI association aiming to : Promote AI and its applications Organize with partners, companies or other student associations events and activities such as conferences, lectures, training workshops, collaborative workshops, professional-student meetings, etc. Organize AI competitions and challenges in France Promoting ethical and responsible AI You can find the free courses we offer on our github page My work at Ens’IA I am taking part in the sessions Ens’IA offers: I am one of the two person giving the lecture.

item.title: Simulator projects
item.author: Author
item.description: The project With two teamates, we implemented 5 different multi-agent simulators using only java. Every simulator we implemented is using an event manager to handle the execution of the next step of the simulation. Balls simulator Ball simulator in actionball simulator " Ball simulator in action Cellular simulators Conway’s game of life. Conway's game of life in actionball simulator " Conway's game of life in action Immigration game Immigration game simulatorball simulator

item.title: Virtual Drag and Drop using hand
item.author: Author
item.description: VirtualDragAndDrop I was kind of bored a week end so I wanted to do something that will be absolutely never used again ðŸ™ƒ. This little project allowed me to get in touch with OpenCV and image processing. The program I built creates a virtual drag and drop on objects represented by their centers. I used rectangle for this example. To use the program, just run the file main.py. Then to move an object, you have to “grab it” = close your hand when your hand is on the object.

item.title: Challenge DATA & AI by Ens'IA and Neovision
item.author: Author
item.description: The challenge: This challenge was organized by Ens’IA and Neovision in 2021. It lasted a month and a half and was about the well known subject of Optical Character Recognition (OCR). What is OCR ? It’s about converting images of typed, handwritten or printed text into machine-encoded text. Learn more âž¡ï¸ The goal was quite simple but still very challenging: building the best model to recognize the characters in the dataset given by Neovision.

item.title: Jpeg decoder to PPM
item.author: Author
item.description: The project This project is about building from scratch a functional JPEG to PPM decoder. I teamed up with 2 other students to build the decoder using C. How it works JPEG format compress images using mathematical methods and algorithms that are described on the official JPEG documentation. process of encoding and decodingIllustration " process of encoding and decoding Huffman coding: The output from Huffman’s algorithm can be viewed as a variable-length code table for encoding a source symbol.

item.title: Size of Connex Components in unoriented 2D graph
item.author: Author
item.description: The project Considering a set of points $p_i$, $1 \le i \le n$, and a limit distance $s$, we want to know the number a connex component of the given set of points and distance. Two vertices $p_i$ and $p_j$ are linked by an edge if $d(p_i, p_j) \le s$. A connex component is a sub-graph where all the vertices are linked by transitivity. A solution I worked in pair with Hugo on different methods.
